communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Josann Reynolds Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All police reports (incident reports, narratives, minutes, etc.) related to Josann Reynolds (DOB unknown but sometime prior to 1965) that were created in the time period 1995 to 2011. If a narrower time is needed, please let me know. I don't believe records will be voluminous in either case. I am looking for one particular report originating at the Dane County Regional Airport.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

John Public

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: HHS CNN appearances
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the dates between March 27th and April 10th, I seek records related to Dr. Robert Redfield and Dr. Anthony Fauci's appearances on CNN. 

I seek any records related to scheduling and or cancellations, including any communications in with other offices that are in possession of the CDC. 

Expedited Processing
Pursant to 5 U.S.C. §552 (a)(6) (E) we request expedited processing as we have a compelling need for information. These records relate to a the government’s response a global pandemic. Therefore we have reasonable belief that “failure to obtain requested records on an expedited basis under this paragraph could reasonably be expected to pose an imminent threat to the life of an individual.”

Additional Instructions
The requests that all fees incurred in connection with the attached request to your agency be waived, because “disclosure of the information is in the public interest and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” 5 U.S.C. §552 (a)(4)(A)(iii). See below for further justification for our fee waiver request. Open The Government is a government accountability non-profit whose work contribute to the public understanding of the function of the Federal government. 

If any of the material covered by this request has been destroyed or removed, please provide all surrounding documentation including, but not limited to, a description of the action taken regarding the materials and justification for those actions taken. For any documents or portions you deny due to a specific FOIA exemption, please provide a Vaughn Index (Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820, 827 (D.C. Cir. 1973), cert. denied, 415 U.S. 977 (1974)), including a detailed justification of your grounds for claiming such exemption and explanation of why the exemption is relevant to the document or portion of the document withheld.

To the extent that some documents may be exempt under 5 U.S.C. §552 (b), we request that you release you segregate non-responsive documents and release the rest.

Please be reminded that under the Freedom of Information Act, we are entitled to a response to this request within ten business days under (a)(6) (E). Should this request be denied for any reason, we ask that a detailed explanation be provided along with the name of the person to whom administrative appeals should be addressed. If you have any questions regarding this request we would appreciate you contacting us directly by email. You may reach me at fmartinez@openthegovernment.org

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Freddy Martinez

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: HHS CNN appearances
communications.communication:
Hi CDC, 

We wanted to clarify the persons and records that we want your department to search. 

First, Dr. Robert Redfield and Dr. Anthony Fauci presumably do not manage their own calendars or communications for appearances on television. So I would say they likely have a communication teams and/or scheduler that manages that. I ask that you search their communications teams, likely the Office Of Communication under Heather Bair-Brake or the Director of Communications staff (under Michelle Bonds) for records. 

Second, I am looking for records related to any attempted scheduling of appearances on CNN by their communication teams. I am also looking for records of any cancellations as well. I would recommend searching for emails with the following keywords: "CNN", "booked", "appearance", "rescheduled", "cancelled", or "on hold". 

Again, we believe that should be enough to properly narrow the scope of the request. 

Best,
Freddy Martinez

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #20-01322
communications.communication: This is an appeal under 5 USC 552. I am challenging the adequacy of the search as we were primarily concerned with the records of Dr Fauci. It was widely reported that the CDC leadership prevented his appearance on CNN and yet none of the records returned to us mention Dr Fauci.

communications.subject: Your The University of Oklahoma public records request #24-1160 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
The University of Oklahoma ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-1160 has been submitted successfully. Greetings- The University of Oklahoma is in receipt of your request. Our office will communicate with departments within the University to identify and retrieve documents responsive to your request. Once those documents are received, they will be reviewed for privileged and confidential information. Upon completion of that review, you will receive notice that the documents are ready and will be transferred based upon your request. As provided for in state law, 51 O.S. § 24A.5.3, the University of Oklahoma may charge for records production, as filed with the County Clerk’s Office, unless your request indicates that it is within the exceptions of the Open Records Act for waiver of fees. Please provide documentation for the basis of any waiver of fees.  Please remember, we are not required to create a new record to respond to requests. We are only required to release documents that the University currently keeps. Also, we are required to release only documents that were available as of the date of the request. Thank you- Open Records Office University of Oklahoma  Whitehand Hall 339 W. Boyd Ave. Rm. 416 Norman, OK 73019 Phone: (405) 325-0202 Fax: (405) 325-9034 openrecords@ou.edu ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact The University of Oklahoma.

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Forest Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Forest Service)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Forest Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to U.S. Forest Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

You requested: 1) All emails in the FS-Chief FOIA Officers email inbox, received, sent and spam folders on October 19, 2024, and 2) Total full-time count of people who work for the FOIA Office as of October 19, 2024. (Date Range for Record Search: From 10/19/2024 To 10/19/2024) Please be advisedthat the WO FOIA Service Center has a backlog of pending FOIA requests.  We are diligently working to process each request inthe order in which it was received.  Your patience is greatly appreciated. communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: July 4th 1980 Merced Visit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All photographs either taken by White House photographers, donated to,  otherwise held, by the Jimmy Carter Presidential Library of President Carter's July 4th 1980 visit to Merced, California. There was an arrival at Castle Air Force Base followed by remarks at Merced College with congressman Tony Coelho and a departure by helicopter to Modesto.

I am interested in the photographs from Castle AFB and Merced that day. I would appreciate any contact sheets as has been granted to similar requests.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Public Records Request for School Related Arrests

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for School Related Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.	Any and all documents relating to or filed in connection with school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request such documents produced to include, but not limited to, the following columns:

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c. Charge (or charges)
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

2.	If such a production of the documents in question 1 is not possible, please provide any reports, incident notes, status updates, or documents which were submitted to DESE as the result of a school based arrest or any such referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement or arrest, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Steinbach

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Mortality Data and Related Policies, 2000-2020
communications.communication:
Anna Neal
Deputy Communications Directory
Wisconsin Department of Corrections
3099 East Washington Ave.
Madison, WI 53704

To Anna Neal:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Law, §19.31 et seq., I hereby request the following records:

– Those which include time and date of all instances of death occurring in the offender population between January 2000 and December 2020.

– Those which indicate the total number of individuals in Wisconsin Department of Corrections (WDOC) custody who died by any cause, separated monthly, from January 2000 to December 2020.

– Monthly population records that include the total number of deaths occurring among people in the custody of the WDOC between January 2000 and December 2020.

– Final reports of death for all individuals in WDOC custody who died between January 2000 and December 2020.


Additionally, I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of any and all WDOC policies, regulations, and procedures, pertaining to...

– Investigations of in-custody deaths.

– Requirements for the performance of an autopsy or post-mortem medical examination of individuals who die while in WDOC custody.

– The reporting of in-custody deaths to other governmental agencies.

– Next-of-kin notification in the event of in-custody deaths.


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. However, we respectfully request a waiver of these fees as we are affiliated with an educational or noncommercial scientific institution, and this request is made for a scholarly or scientific purpose and not for a commercial use.

I would request a response in writing, within the 5 days described by law, if you intend to deny this request. I would also request that you please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

Sincerely,


Forrest Behne
Policy Director, COVID Prison Project
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

Office: (919) 391-7962
340 MacNider Hall | Campus Box 7240
333 South Columbia Street
Chapel Hill, NC 27599-7240

communications.subject: Welcome to the Wisconsin Department of Corrections Public Records Center
communications.communication:
Dear Forrest Behne: 
 
Thank you for registering with the Wisconsin Department of Corrections Public Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  112690-52605186@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you.  From your account you can track and monitor the status of your request and receive records, if any, in response to your request.  You can also send messages to the records custodian who will be responding to your request. 
 
 
If the Department of Corrections has created an account on your behalf, or you cannot remember your password, you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password.  Then use your e-mail address and temporary password to set your new password and access your request.  Be sure to check your spam folder as some messages you receive from us may end up there. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HeNPJKonD7OnFki2wrV5RqAAZnC-2FSIH2ZeMhsuPFDTlvrEsojzoZ44HciwPel9t3cfqnoFcrd-2FckChQr-2BLosCKk-3D55lJ_YMDZEFl63AGQLCEc5IWRFTXvHQIrsSRMpE7ueRItQk2qBxzvKGJnQAMcsckISMZtVSBSZZU2wmmXhkXaelIrGIReF8ANdeqVQq97ECy2xiZ6-2BGui0GxEiA8RyuN44Wni-2FjcWEjH91N29kLn10oWKgeo18-2FjuSJzNCA5weNOl9lmFELv-2FnuPXlqGJjsxR-2FC3fc5nihcNbIIZrggkJh0lnOJFfEjzQ3RjyvvWooGxvrnM-3D) 
 
Please login to "My Records Center" to update your account information, send messages, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored e-mail account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Public Records Request-R :: R016222-041723
communications.communication:
Dear Forrest Behne: 
This email acknowledges receipt of your Department of Corrections public records request .  Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Wisconsin's Public Records Law (Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31 - 19.37). Your request was received in this office on 4/17/2023 and given the reference number R016222-041723 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: See attached letter. 
Your request is being forwarded to the appropriate records custodians for processing. You will be contacted about any cost associated with your request and when the records responsive to your request, if any, are ready. PLEASE NOTE: Wisconsin Public Records Law (Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31 - 19.37) does not require a governmental body to create new information, do legal research, or answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed.  Thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Wisconsin Department of Corrections

communications.subject: Wisconsin Department of Corrections Public Records Center Public Records Request-R :: R016222-041723
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
RE: Public Records Request of April 17, 2023, Reference # R016222-041723. 
Dear Forrest Behne: 
The Wisconsin Department of Corrections received a public records request from you on April 17, 2023. Your request mentioned: Instances of death January 2000 to December 2020 
In your letter you reference a prior request in 2021 for these records.  We cannot find record of  having received that request.  Therefore, we are entering this as a new request today.  If you find that we provided a public records request tracking number previously, please provide that number and we can again search our historical records for more information. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to log into your request in the public records portal and send us a message by clicking on the New Message button at the top. 
Sincerely, 
ORM Team 

Office of Records Management

communications.subject: Wisconsin Department of Corrections Public Records Center Public Records Request-R :: R016222-041723
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: Public Records Request of April 17, 2023, Reference # R016222-041723. 
Dear Forrest Behne: 
The Wisconsin Department of Corrections received a public records request from you on April 17, 2023. Your request mentioned: “See attached letter.” 
The Wisconsin Department of Corrections has reviewed its files and has located records responsive to your request. Please log in to the Public Records Center at the below link to retrieve the responsive records. 
Public Records Request-R - R016222-041723 
Note that part of your request asked for various “policies, regulations, and procedures.” Policies related to the death of a person in our care are available on our public website at https://doc.wi.gov/Pages/AboutDOC/DepartmentPolicies/DAIPolicies.aspx. Regarding your request for the policy on “performance of an autopsy or post-mortem medical examination,” these are not conducted by the DOC. 
Your request for “final reports of death” is unclear, but please understand that time and cause of death is determined by the county medical examiner and not the DOC. They may be better suited to address these aspects of your request, but you are welcome to provide additional details about the records you seek. 
Your public records request is now considered closed. 
Sincerely, 
Office of Public Affairs 
OOS-OPA

title: Public Records Request: Western States Public Order Conference Materials

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request: Western States Public Order Conference Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

From January 29 to February 1, 2024, Portland Police hosted the Western States Public Order conference. 

Provide all presentation materials from the conference and presented to attendees. This includes but is not limited to: 
- Powerpoint or any visual slides 
- Handouts 
- Videos or audio files (if files are hosted elsewhere and require login in or access, please provide a copy of the material and note why the original was not available). 
- Also provide any recordings of sessions, panels, presentations made by City of Portland staff.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: You have an invoice available :: S345388-061624
communications.communication:
RE:  Public Records Request#: S345388-061624 
 
Dear e e, 
 
 PAYMENT DUE 
 
The City may be the custodian of at least some of the requested public records and a payment is due to continue processing this request. Please log into the Portland Public Records Request Center to pay these fees. 
 
Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. We will not be working on your request until we receive the payment. 
 
Please log in to the Portland Public Records Request Center (copy and right click this link to open it in your browser) and make a payment on this request.
You may pay by electronic check or credit card by going to "My Public Records Request Center" and select "View My Invoices." Then scroll to find your open invoice and select "Make Payment." Follow the screen prompts to make a payment. 
 
Due to the current state of emergency, most City offices are not staffed. Consequently, if you mail a check it could delay the response time and it is preferable that you use the online payment portal to make an electronic payment. However, if you need to mail a check, please reply to this message and ask for the correct address. Please be sure and provide your Reference Number (S345388-061624) on your check. 
 
Please be advised that pursuant to ORS 192.329(3)(b) and (4)(b), your public records request will be closed if payment is not received within sixty (60) days of this invoice. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
City of Portland Public Records Responder 
 
 
 *Please note that you will need to disable your pop-up blocker on your browser's settings in order to make an online payment.
*Please see this Answer for more information:  A006257-010816 If you are having technical difficulties with the website, please contact the website administrator by phone or email.  (503) 823-6040 or prrhelp@portlandoregon.gov

title: David Levy (Hebrew: דוד לוי; 21 December 1937 – 2 June 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David Levy (Hebrew: דוד לוי; 21 December 1937 – 2 June 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former Israeli foreign minister David Levy (21 December 1937 – 2 June 2024), whose name is spelled in Hebrew  דוד לוי and may also be transliterated David Levi. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/02/obituaries/david-levy-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an investigative journalist who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Transition Briefing documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the primary briefing materials prepared in part or whole for purposes of the Presidential Transition Process, specifically any presentations created for, or delivered to, members of the Presidential Transition Team for the new administration.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Westchester County Excited Delirium Training Materials

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Westchester County Excited Delirium Training Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all training materials used in the past four years (January 1, 2020 through January 1, 2024) that mention excited delirium / agitated delirium / bell's mania / lethal catatonia.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Marion Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Transportation Security Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Transportation Security Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Transportation Security Administration,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Transportation Security Administration's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Pawtucket Police Department)

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Pawtucket Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All charging documents filed by your department in all cases of:

11-34.1-2. Prostitution
11-34.1-3. Procurement of sexual conduct for a fee.
11-34-11. Loitering for indecent purposes in or near schools
11-34.1-6 Soliciting from a vehicle
23-20.8-3 Practicing massage without a license

filed by your department between July of 2021 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bella Robinson

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Christopher Morris Request 2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records pertaining to the arrest of Christopher Morris, 50, on or around June 24, 2022, for charges including sexual abuse and sodomy. This includes the incident report and full investigative file. Redactions for privacy of minors are understood/expected.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Molly Hensley-Clancy

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Louisville Metro Government public records request #24-13218
communications.communication:
Louisville Metro Government ************************************************************************ A document has been released for record request #24-13218 along with the following message: Your request is Commercial Purpose.  KRS 61.870(4) defines “commercial purpose” as “the direct or indirect use of any part of a public record or records, in any form, for sale, resale, solicitation, rent, or lease of a service, or any use by which the user expects a profit either through commission, salary, or fee.” However, “commercial purpose” does not include the publication or related use of the public record by a newspaper or periodical, by a radio or television station in its news or informational program, or by use in the prosecution or defense of litigation by the parties to such an action or their attorney.  Fees charged by Metro departments vary and fees will be based off the hourly rate of the employee(s) who process the request. Please complete, sign, and upload the completed form in NextRequest (you don’t have to mail the form to us) to move forward with your request. If this form is not returned in 5 business days, your request will be closed. * BLANK CP FORM.pdf Document links are valid for one month. After November 11, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Louisville Metro Government.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: RE: Kentucky Open Records Act Request #24-13218
communications.communication:
Hi,

My public records request was incorrectly classified as for a "Commercial Purpose." I am a journalist for The Washington Post and my use of the public record falls under the exception "the publication or related use of the public record by a newspaper or periodical, by a radio or television station in its news or informational program."

Thank you,
Molly

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Louisville Metro Government public records request #24-13218
communications.communication:
Louisville Metro Government ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-13218: Specific to your request for body/dash camera video: I have located video responsive to your request. This record(s) is not otherwise available. Our department needs additional time to prepare the records for release. Extension for release is necessary because the requested records require additional steps before it can be made available for public release. As the requested record was created during the course of police business, it is expected to contain a mixture of exempt and non-exempt information. The exempt information is likely of a personal nature of the involved person(s) or CJIS-protected information, which is prohibited from release. To go further into detail which is specific to the process of researching, locating and redacting body/dash camera video requests. Currently, our unit only has four members who are solely responsible for the entire department's open records requests where body/dash camera video are being requested. (As well as any audio/video which are included in case file requests). For each request we are assigned we must conduct a search by officer and date. If video is located, we must determine whether an investigation/court case related to the incident is open. We then must download each video, one at a time, and then watch and manually redact any exempted information. We do this to protect the privacy of our citizens as well for CJIS security requirements. Unfortunately, only one item/image/sound may be redacted at a time; if there are multiple exempt items, they must be redacted individually. There is no automatic process to redact exempt items. For every minute of video it is estimated it takes 7 minutes of “redaction/review”. Some requests take as little as 30 minutes to an hour to complete, while some can take over a week. And often one request doesn't equal one video. Some requests can have two, five, ten, etc.   For all the reasons stated above, pursuant to KRS 61.872(5), the non-exempt responsive records will be made available on or before March 11th, 2025.   To remain fair and unbiased to requestors, we process in the order they are received. Our unit currently has an estimated 1,000+ pending requests for video. We are working as diligently as possible given the resources and personnel allotted to our unit. If we get to your request ahead of the quoted date, it will be provided earlier. Video may be provided faster via subpoena if applicable. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Louisville Metro Government.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Leonard Crowdog
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry or FBI association with Leonard Crowdog. This request is to include, but not limited to, FD-209 records. Please note that Mr. Crowdog is deceased and thus privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. You may find an obituary, published in the New York Times, here: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/23/us/leonard-crow-dog-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices. Additionally, this request includes, but is not limited to, all files concerning the above-named individual originating from the  Minneapolis, Minnesota field office, as well as the state's resident agencies, and the resident agency offices in South Dakota, between 1972 - 1977.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Damon Tabor

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=16178

Supply the Investigative Memoranda with the following File Numbers: 
Investigative Memorandum #9525 RESPONSE: The information you seek is exempt from disclosure pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f) exempts any “Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” Investigative Memorandum #9522 
RESPONSE: The information you seek is exempt from disclosure as it is factual information inextricably intertwined with a pending matter. P ursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f) exempts any “Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” It is also exempt pursuant to (n): Records relating to a public body’s adjudication of employee grievances or disciplinary cases; however, this exemption shall not extend the final outcome of cases in which discipline is imposed. Investigative Memorandum #9519 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including private phone numbers, employee identification numbers, and date of birth. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy.

The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. 
Redactions were additionally made to conceal individual identities pursuant to Section 7(1)(d)(iv) which allows a public to withhold records/information that would unavoidably reveal the identity of a complainant or witness. title: Thornton Police Department, Thornton, CO Request

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Thornton Police Department, Thornton, CO Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Abatement of nuisance properties as described in Sec. 38-994. of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Access Board,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to U.S. Access Board's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements (Central Washington University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements (Central Washington University)
communications.communication:
Hello - 

I assume you're asking for a date range for the agreement terms? The documents I am seeking are often a beverage sponsorship or pouring rights agreement, sometimes they are 5-10 years long so it is hard to know an exact date. Or if there is no primary beverage pouring rights partnership then there may not be a related document. 

Let me know if this provides any of the clarity you need, thanks!
Kelly

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements (Central Washington University)
communications.communication:
Good morning, Kelly:


Thank you for responding to my request for clarification in response to your public records request dated October 16, 2024,) requesting the following documents:

"Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas."

Per your response on October 28th,  my understanding is that you are requesting:

"Open and active agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas."

Please consider this email "Notice" that I will require additional time to respond to your request to compile and review the responsive records.  I anticipate that I should have these records ready for reproduction on or before February 25, 2025.

Please also note, pursuant to https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx?cite=106-276-090<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx?cite=106-276-090__;!!GNNzyw!kr1tIF9KmUjkBP2rhzd1kf98iOmPoZ6i8nQOcEwL5CbKyUTMThcTxaMtuVx0W8kwseo$> there may be a charge for the records that you requested.  A fee schedule can be found at this link:  https://www.cwu.edu/business-services/public-records .

Please contact me at (509) 963-2310 if you have any questions or if my understanding of the request's date range is not the information you are seeking.

Kind regards,

 Because the records are being produced electronically, the reproduction fee has been waived. As a result, as of the date of this email, your records request is considered closed. Christine Bowers
Program Specialist

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Geese Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints submitted to the department from 2020 to 2024 containing the terms "Goose", "goose", "Geese", or "geese"

If this request is too broad, a fulfillment of only complaints about aggressive geese will also suffice.

This is in the public interest, as New York lays claim to a population of 200,000 geese (https://dec.ny.gov/nature/animals-fish-plants/canada-goose), and geese are commonly described as annoying, aggressive or loud, resulting in interesting complaints about them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brianna Cluck

communications.communication:
Hi,

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it, and I can already find interesting information just from a cursory scan through it.

Genuinely, thank you for fulfilling this request.  I understand it's a little unusual, and I appreciate the time and effort you all have put into fulfilling it.

Sincerely,
Brianna Cluck

You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Aug. 19, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date. Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

title: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Public Affairs Responses to In-Custody Deaths at Aurora, Torrance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the Al Otro Lado #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative, we respectfully request all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. Specifically, we seek emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/brazilian-man-ice-custody-passes-away-new-mexico-hospital?s=09
and here: 
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/nicaraguan-man-ice-custody-passes-away-colorado-hospital

By definition, the information requested cannot be subject to withholding under Exemption 7A (open investigations), because ICE has already released its core facts publicly.

We seek expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 in support thereof: 
1. Both the Torrance in-custody death and the Aurora in-custody death have been met with calls from elected Representatives and Senators for vigorous investigation, based on each facility's documented track record. See https://www.heinrich.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/heinrich-leads-request-for-immediate-action-from-ice-to-address-inhumane-unsafe-conditions-for-migrants-at-the-torrance-county-detention-facility and https://crow.house.gov/sites/evo-subsites/crow.house.gov/files/evo-media-document/2022.10.21-final-icedhs-letter_0.pdf. 

2. Both deaths have been the subject of widespread and sustained media attention. 
For Torrance: 
https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/22/us/politics/aclu-ice-immigration-detention.html
https://sourcenm.com/2022/09/01/brazilian-asylum-seeker-who-died-by-suicide-held-in-horrific-conditions-attorneys-say/
https://nmpoliticalreport.com/2022/08/31/immigrant-advocacy-organizations-seeking-answers-around-brazilian-mans-death-by-suicide-while-in-ice-custody/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/10/18/headlines/asylum_seekers_at_torrance_ice_jail_claim_retaliation_over_hunger_strike
https://theappeal.org/torrance-detention-center-kesley-vial-brazil/
https://www.santafenewmexican.com/opinion/letters_to_editor/close-torrance-county-ice-facility-now/article_08a7cf58-5705-11ed-b432-1bb650ab5a32.html
https://www.krqe.com/news/crime/man-commits-suicide-in-ice-custody-in-torrance-county/
https://www.democracynow.org/2022/8/29/headlines/asylum_seeker_dies_by_suicide_at_for_profit_ice_jail_in_new_mexico
https://www.abqjournal.com/2528527/webhedline-126.html
https://www.lcsun-news.com/story/news/local/new-mexico/2022/09/30/groups-retaliation-after-migrants-report-torrance-county-detention-center/69530415007/

For Aurora: 
https://www.cpr.org/2022/10/27/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-investigation-into-death-at-aurora-ice-facility/
https://www.cpr.org/2022/11/03/advocates-immigration-customs-enforcement-custody-death/
https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/man-nicaragua-dies-aurora-ice-facility/73-f52d0d45-531c-4e17-a361-1376d887e499
https://www.denver7.com/news/local-news/colorado-lawmakers-call-for-probe-after-detainees-death-at-aurora-ice-facility
https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/melvin-ariel-calero-mendoza-nicaraguan-father-dies-ice-custody-aurora-facility/
https://www.longmontleader.com/local-news/el-comite-wants-answers-to-ice-detention-death-5990654
https://news.yahoo.com/video/nicaraguan-father-two-dies-ice-040542382.html
https://www.newsbreak.com/news/2810691040469/report-details-what-led-up-to-man-s-death-in-aurora-ice-custody

3. In both cases, serious questions have been raised by elected officials as to the circumstances surrounding each person's death, and ICE and its contractors' compliance with mandatory duties surrounding care of detained immigrants. 

Therefore, the requirements of 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) are satisfied, and expedited processing is proper. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this important request, and your response within the statutorily required 10-calendar day period! 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
12/21/2022Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03462        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your 11/8/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all records created or received by ICE's Office of Public Affairs at the Headquarters, El Paso Field Office, and Denver Field Office levels regarding the deaths in custody of Kesley Dial at CoreCivic's Torrance, New Mexico facility and The GEO Group's Aurora, Colorado facility. .  Your request was received in this office on 11/8/2022.After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is 1) too broad in scope, 2) did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking, or 3) only posed questions to the agency.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the ICE program office you believe created and/or controls the record.  The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.  Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking.  Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request.If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.  Please be advised that this action is not a denial of your request and will not preclude you from filing other requests in the future. If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Marcus Francis at (866) 633-1182 or the address above.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-03462. Sincerely,ICE-FOIA 
This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution
 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. 
Deloitte refers to a Deloitte member firm, one of its related entities, or Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited ("DTTL"). Each Deloitte member firm is a separate legal entity and a member of DTTL. DTTL does not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about

v.E.1

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICFO-03462
communications.communication:
We appeal the agency’s determination that the request is improper. 

It seeks:

“emails sent or received, calendar entries for appointments to discuss either of the deaths in custody, Teams messages, the contents of SharePoint drive folders regarding ICE's public statements regarding these deaths, and any records relied upon to assert the factual matters in ICE's post-death release statements, posted [on ICE’s website].”

We seek expedited processing of this request for the reasons described in our original submission. 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

communications.subject: ICE FOIA [Request|Request ID]
communications.communication:
01/10/2023Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR136588Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICAP-00243Dear Requester:The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 12/23/2022, was received on 1/5/2023.The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2023-ICAP-00243 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal.A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Marcus Francis, ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009.Sincerely,							Shiraz PanthakyChiefGovernment Information Law DivisionICE Office of the Principal Legal AdvisorU.S. Department of Homeland Security

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #2023-ICAP-00243.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).

SecureRelease website support staff are not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel.

According to our records, request 2023-ICAP-00243 was not submitted through the SecureRelease Request Portal, therefore, we are unable to provide online status tracking or portal messaging capabilities for this request.

We have CC’ed the ICE FOIA inbox for visibility. To follow up further on this request, please refer to communications you received from the agency for contact instructions or reach out to the agency in the same manner that you submitted your request.

Regards,

SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good day,

In regards to 2023-ICAP+00243, we have queried the appropriate component of DHS for responsive records.  If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability.  We will process your request as expeditiously as possible.  Upon completion of the processing, all documents that can be released will be made available to you as soon as possible.

Thank you,
ICE FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
You are legally required to provide an estimated date on which documents will be produced.

You are legally required to make a determination on this request and inform us of it. 

You are legally required to make records promptly available. 

You have failed to comply with any of these requirements. 

If you have any intention of doing so within the next fourteen days, please inform us. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-ICAP-00243
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 

Your assertion that “a high number of FOIA requests have been received by the Department” is unsupported by the Department’s own FY22 Chief FOIA Officer Report. In other words, you’re saying a thing that your own data demonstrate is untrue. 

But go off, I guess. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free

12/12/2023 

Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136588 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICAP-00071, 2024-ICFO-06913 

Dear Requester: 

The Department of Homeland Security has received your letter appealing the adverse determination of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. Your appeal, postmarked or electronically transmitted on 11/22/2023, was received on 12/11/2023. 

The Government Information Law Division acknowledges your appeal request of and is assigning it number 2024-ICAP-00071 for tracking purposes.  Please reference this number in any future communications about your appeal. 

A high number of FOIA/PA requests have been received by the Department.  Accordingly, we have adopted the court-sanctioned practice of generally handling backlogged appeals on a first-in, first-out basis.   While we will make every effort to process your appeal on a timely basis, there may be some delay in resolving this matter.  Should you have any questions concerning the processing of your appeal, please contact Fernando Pineiro Jr., ICE FOIA Office/Public Liaison at (866) 633-1182 or at 500 12th St., SW Washington, DC 20536-5009. 

Sincerely, 
 
Sara Jazayeri 
Acting Chief 
Government Information Law Division

U.S. Department of Homeland Security

Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00162 
 
Dear Requester: 

This email is in response to your status inquiry regarding ICE FOIA 2024-ICAP-00162, in which you have requested Appeal. This will capture the combined time frame for records from April 1, 2021, through December 15, 2023.. 

As of today, the search for responsive documents is complete and your request is currently in queue to be processed. If responsive records have been located, they will be reviewed for a determination of releasability. 

ICE FOIA apologizes for the delay in the processing of your request. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-ICAP-00162. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009
